question.title: My code has suddenly started cropping out sections of my JFrame with no changes or alterations to the code
question.body:
I've been coding a project in Netbeans on Java, and it makes use of a series of JFrames for login screens, main menus etc. I was coding it yesterday and was working just as expected, with everything being displayed as normal. I saved my code and logged off after being happy with the progress, and didn't change anything else until this morning.

When I booted up the project this morning, I ran it first to recap on my progress, and encountered these strange cropping errors with the display. Thought it was to do with the ImageIcon labels I had for backgrounds, but seems to be cropping the components such as buttons and labels too... Is this clientside or is there some sort of corruption with my code? Here are some screenshots of the login screen, before and after for comparison, although it occurs on all screens: Normal screen from yesterday Corrupted/altered image from today

The ‘normal’ image was taken before I finalized the labels etc. so that’s why it appears incomplete. The screenshots are exactly as I see the jFrames on my screen, cropped just after the edges

I am also fairly new to coding in Netbeans, but have not experienced any problems even remotely similar to this. I tried messing around with display aspect ratios, icon sizes etc. in my computer display settings but the windows always remained the exact same with no changes to how much was cropped or which parts were cropped. When I try to press where the buttons should be that are cropped out there is nothing, no response from the program or any sort of indication they are even there, but everything seems fine in the designer window of the JFrames

question_comments.body: I get the same problem when I run the code in your question. I don't know why but it appears you simply want to set a background image so rather than using a JLayeredPane, I suggest setting a background image on a JPanel.
